content: First Singaporean female district judge **Jenny Lau Buong Bee** (1932 - 9 June 2013) was a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporeans) lawyer and judge. She was the first woman to become a district judge in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Before Singapore was a country, she was the first [magistrate](/wiki/Magistrate) in [Malaya](/wiki/Federation_of_Malaya). ## Biography Lau grew up in a large family with seven sisters. She attended the [Methodist Girls' School](/wiki/Methodist_Girls%27_School,_Singapore). She then went on to study law at [Lincoln's Inn](/wiki/Lincoln%27s_Inn) in [London](/wiki/London). Afterwards, she was called to the [English Bar](/wiki/Barristers_in_England_and_Wales) in 1957 and then in 1958, to the Singapore Bar. Lau worked for a private [law firm](/wiki/Law_firm) for a short time in Singapore. On April 4, 1960, she became the first woman to serve as a [magistrate](/wiki/Magistrate) in [Malaya](/wiki/Federation_of_Malaya). In 1966, she was the first woman to appointed a district judge in Singapore. Lau died on 9 June 2013, after fighting [cancer](/wiki/Cancer). She was inducted into the [Singapore Women's Hall of Fame](/wiki/Singapore_Women%27s_Hall_of_Fame) in 2014.
title: Jenny Lau Buong Bee
